author: Heather Wake
title: Lily Allen's joke about her kids 'ruining' her career is a spot-on comment about motherhood
text:
Pop Culture
Lily Allen's joke about her kids 'ruining' her career is a spot-on comment about motherhood
No, most women can't "have it all."
Wikipedia_(cropped).jpg)
‚ÄúYou can have it all.‚Äù
This has been a
post-3rd wave feminism promise sworn to women. That you can have a big family, a high achieving career, a fulfilling relationship, a never-ending sense of purpose, no bad hair days, healthy lunches that make themselves, and so on and so on. myth. There is still measurable inequalitybetween men and women when it comes to being able to advance in their careers and have children. Even the ones who do seem to ‚Äúhave it all‚Äù are the exception to the rule, and likely have sacrificed other aspects of their identity.
That goes for pop stars too, apparently. While appearing on an episode of the
Radio Times Podcast, British singer Lily Allen spoke candidly about her own experience of not being able to move up in the music industry after becoming a mom.
Allen shot to prominence in 2006 thanks to her hit song ‚ÄúSmile.‚Äù Only two years later, she earned a nomination for best alternative music album at the 2008 Grammy Awards for debut album, "Alright Still.‚Äù
But instead, Allen followed in the footsteps of celebrities like Rick Moranis, and chose to focus on her children.
"Some people choose their career over their children, and that‚Äôs their prerogative," she explained. "My parents were quite absent when I was a kid, and I feel like that really left some nasty scars that I'm not willing to repeat on mine. I‚Äôm glad that I have done that, because I think they‚Äôre pretty well-rounded people.‚Äù
In other words: ‚ÄúMy children ruined my career,‚Äù she joked, before adding ‚ÄúI love them and they complete me, but in terms of pop stardom, totally ruined it.‚Äù
Though Allen has no regrets, she brought up the story to address how unrealistic it is for most women to be able to do both, and being told otherwise by society is less-than-empowering.
"It really annoys me when people say you can have it all, because ‚Äî quite frankly ‚Äî you can‚Äôt."
Between pay inequality, difference in work life balance, corporate attitudes towards pregnancy leave, and already being less likely to advance than their male counterparts even without the factor of children (not to mention the world not fully being set up for two working parents with zero community support) it feels safe to assume that Allen is touching on something fairly universal here.
Though her pop star chapter might have reached a close, Allen seems to still be living a pretty cool life‚Äî from her swanky
New York apartment with David Harbour to winning awards for her stage acting. So though she might not ‚Äúhave it all,‚Äù she certainly has some pretty cool things going for her.

author: people.com
title: Canada Women's Soccer Coach Suspended from Olympics for 'Drone Use'
text:
The coach for Canada ‚Äòs Olympic women‚Äôs soccer team has been suspended over alleged drone use to spy on opponents. On Thursday, the Canadian Olympic Committee announced that Bev Priestman will no longer lead the team at the games , following a FIFA and IOC investigation that tied her to drone use ‚Äúpredating‚Äù the Olympics .
‚ÄúOver the past 24 hours, additional information has come to our attention regarding previous drone use against opponents, predating the Paris 2024 Olympic Games,‚Äù read a statement from Canada Soccer CEO Kevin Blue. ‚ÄúIn light of these new revelations, Canada Soccer has made the decision to suspend Women‚Äôs National Team Head Coach, Bev Priestman, for the remainder of the Paris 2024 Olympic Games.‚Äù
Priestman‚Äôs suspension will last until the completion of an independent investigation from Canada‚Äôs soccer governing board, Blue explained. Assistant coach Andy Spence will take on interim coaching duties for the remainder of the games.
Canada WNT Head Coach Bev Priestman has been sent home from the 2024 Olympics, COC announced üá®üá¶ pic.twitter.com/jkXURVrtqT
‚Äî FOX Soccer (@FOXSoccer) July 25, 2024 The decision to remove Priestman comes days after a non-accredited member of the Canada Soccer team was detained detained by French authorities following an incident in Saint-√âtienne. The discovery of the drone usage led to the removal of two staff members from the team. On Wednesday, Priestman denied her involvement in the incident.
Canadian Olympic Committee (COC) said a ‚Äúnon-accredited member of the Canada Soccer support team‚Äù had been detained by French authorities in Saint-√âtienne, a city 250 miles south of Paris, for improperly using a drone.
‚ÄúIrrespective of the details, I‚Äôm ultimately accountable for this team,‚Äù the coach said following a team practice, per The Guardian . ‚ÄúBy no means did I direct the individuals.‚Äù
‚ÄúI‚Äôm still learning the details and obviously this is all unfolding,‚Äù she added. ‚ÄúBut again, I think the important thing right now is to look forward, put the actions in place and take the sanctions.‚Äù
The COC had released a statement Wednesday that Joseph Lombardi, an unaccredited analyst with Canada Soccer, and Jasmine Mander, an assistant coach to whom Lombardi allegedly reported, were ‚Äúsent home immediately.‚Äù Trending Elon Musk's Daughter Fires Back After He Says She Was 'Killed' By 'Woke Mind Virus' So ... What's With This Rumor That J.D. Vance Had Sex With a Couch? Trump Allies Warn Him: Underestimate Kamala at Your Peril Kamala Harris Debuts First Campaign Ad ... With Some Help From Beyonc√©
Team Canada had been notified of two separate drone incidents: one on July 22 in Saint-√âtienne, and another on July 19 at New Zealand‚Äôs practice. Canada defeated New Zealand 2-1 on Thursday during the team‚Äôs Paris Olympic debut, although Priestman was not at the game.
Canada is next set to play France, the Games‚Äô host, on July 28 as part of the competition‚Äôs Group A, which also includes New Zealand and Colombia. Canada is the reigning gold medal winners.

author: Diario Libre
title: Marine Le Pen advierte que impedir√° el env√≠o de tropas a Ucrania - Diario Libre
text:
A tres d√≠as de la primera vuelta de las cruciales elecciones legislativas en Francia, la ultraderechista Marine Le Pen ha elevado la apuesta sobre una posible cohabitaci√≥n pol√≠tica al afirmar que el t√≠tulo de "jefe de las fuerzas armadas" para el presidente es "honor√≠fico". Le Pen asegura que al controlar los fondos destinados a las operaciones militares podr√° rechazar el env√≠o de tropas a Ucrania, lo que Emmanuel Macron ha evitado descartar.
¬øQu√© ocurrir√° con la pol√≠tica exterior de Francia en caso de una victoria de Agrupaci√≥n Nacional en las elecciones legislativas ? ¬øQu√© pasar√° si el presidente Macron, que debe quedarse en el poder hasta el 2027 debe convivir con, como primer ministro, Jordan Bardella, del partido de la derecha radical? ¬øD√≥nde quedar√° el apoyo diplom√°tico y militar de Francia?
Esta situaci√≥n, llamada de "cohabitaci√≥n" del poder entre un presidente y un primer ministro de distinto signo pol√≠tico supone un reparto de las prerrogativas. Durante las tres cohabitaciones pol√≠ticas anteriores en Francia, el Presidente conserv√≥ amplios poderes en materia de pol√≠tica internacional y defensa, en virtud de este "dominio reservado". Sin embargo, Agrupaci√≥n Nacional podr√≠a cambiar esta tradici√≥n.
En una entrevista concedida al diario T√©l√©gramme , la probable candidata a las elecciones presidenciales de 2027 Marine Le pen subray√≥ que "es el Primer Ministro quien maneja la chequera ". Por ello, en su opini√≥n, "el Presidente no podr√° enviar tropas a Ucrania", aunque Emmanuel Macron se ha negado a descartar esta opci√≥n.
El cargo de primer ministro ser√° para el partido de extrema derecha si obtiene la mayor√≠a absoluta en la Asamblea al t√©rmino de los comicios del 30 de junio y el 7 de julio.
Fran√ßois Bayrou, presidente del partido centrista Modem y estrecho aliado del jefe del Estado, considera que Marine Le Pen ha "desafiado profundamente la Constituci√≥n" con esta declaraci√≥n "extremadamente grave".
"Cuando los partidos nacionalistas y populistas han ganado el poder en toda Europa, han aplicado una estrategia met√≥dica para arrogarse plenos poderes", a√±adi√≥ el ministro franc√©s de Asuntos Europeos, Jean-No√´l Barrot.
Sin embargo, Le Pen pareci√≥ matizar esta afirmaci√≥n el jueves por la ma√±ana en X aludiendo al "dominio reservado del Presidente de la Rep√∫blica" sobre estos temas sensibles de pol√≠tica exterior y defensa, pero mantuvo que "el primer ministro dispone, a trav√©s del control presupuestario, de los medios para oponerse" al env√≠o de tropas al extranjero.
"Si llegamos al poder (...), no ser√° para fingir", a√±adi√≥ el vicepresidente de RN, S√©bastien Chenu, refiri√©ndose a otras "l√≠neas rojas" como la negativa a suministrar a Kiev armas de largo alcance.
Por el momento, se prev√© que la extrema derecha se imponga en la primera vuelta del domingo, con un 36% de las intenciones de voto, seg√∫n un sondeo Ipsos-Fondation Jean-Jaur√®s-Cevipof-Institut Montaigne realizado entre cerca de 12,000 personas para Le Monde .
Seg√∫n este amplio estudio, que no ofrece proyecciones en t√©rminos de esca√±os, la izquierda cosechar√≠a el 29% de los votos, el bando del presidente Macron el 19,5% y Les R√©publicains (derecha tradicional) el 8%.
Sin embargo, hay muchas inc√≥gnitas en las 577 elecciones en cada circunscripci√≥n, y es probable que las ecuaciones se alteren radicalmente entre las dos vueltas en funci√≥n del n√∫mero de apoyos, retiradas o incluso instrucciones de voto.
Una mayor√≠a relativa abrir√≠a tambi√©n la perspectiva de un bloqueo institucional, reforzado por la negativa del l√≠der de extrema derecha, Jordan Bardella, a formar gobierno sin mayor√≠a absoluta.
TEMAS - Marine Le Pen Seguir Tema + Siguiendo ‚úì Agrupaci√≥n Nacional Seguir Tema + Siguiendo ‚úì Elecciones legislativas Seguir Tema + Siguiendo ‚úì RFI RFI es una radio francesa de actualidad, difundida a escala mundial en franc√©s y en 15 idiomas m√°s, mediante 156 repetidores de FM en ondas medias y cortas en una treintena de sat√©lites a destino de los cinco continentes, en Internet y en aplicaciones conectadas, que cuenta con m√°s de 2,000 radios asociadas que emiten sus programas.
En portada Ver todos Actualidad Eugenio Cede√±o culpa a la prensa por sus nefastas declaraciones

author: reporters@dailyrecord.co.uk (Rachel Williams)
title: Lidl's champagne 'better than Mo√´t & Chandon' slashed to under ¬£10 ahead of New Year
text: We may have just had Christmas less than a week ago, but another party event is fast approaching - Hogmanay. If you're planning to ring in the New Year, then chances are that you will be on the hunt for another bottle of bubbly. However, some of us might have been a bit over indulgent over the festive period and might need to head to the shops over the next few days. Luckily, partygoers can nab a bargain, as Lidl has today slashed the cost of its award-winning [Montaudon Champagne Brut](https://www.lidl.co.uk/p/montaudon-champagner-aop-brut/p178908) to under a tenner. Originally priced at ¬£14.99, the supermarket's champagne is reduced to ¬£9.99 for [Lidl Plus members](https://www.lidl.co.uk/c/lidl-plus/s10023095) - and there is a three bottle maximum for each customer. Lauded by experts, this budget bottle of fizz recently went toe-to-toe with some heavyweights in a blind taste test panel. The result found that six out of 10 participants thought Lidl's champagne was "better than Mo√´t & Chandon." Boasting delicate aromas of citrus fruits and a dry-finish, the supermarket's Montaudon Champagne Brut was also praised by Decanter magazine for its ‚Äúreal depth and complexity for the price." Meanwhile, Good Housekeeping called it the "best budget champagne." Shoppers are not just winning on taste, but also price, as Tesco stocks a [75cl bottle of Moet & Chandon Brut Imperial Non Vintage Champagne](https://go.skimresources.com?id=76202X1529444&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.tesco.com%2Fgroceries%2Fen-GB%2Fproducts%2F255245509&sref=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dailyrecord.co.uk%2Flifestyle%2Ffood-drink%2Flidls-champagne-better-mot--31762678) at ¬£43 for regular shoppers and ¬£35 for Clubcard members. It means that Lidl customers are saving themselves between ¬£43 and ¬£25 for a bottle of bubbly that matches the quality of the premium champagne house. A bottle of the prestigious champagne has also been slashed to ¬£35 at [Amazon](https://amzn.to/3NHxGkJ) and [Sainsbury's.](https://go.skimresources.com?id=76202X1529444&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sainsburys.co.uk%2Fgol-ui%2Fproduct%2Fmo%25C3%25ABt-chandon-imp%25C3%25A9rial-brut-non-vintage-champagne-75cl&sref=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dailyrecord.co.uk%2Flifestyle%2Ffood-drink%2Flidls-champagne-better-mot--31762678) Either way, Lidl [shoppers](http://ord.co.uk/all-about/shopping) are still getting the cheaper deal for New Year's Eve this year. Join the [Daily Record's WhatsApp community here](https://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/news/scottish-news/join-daily-records-whatsapp-community-31116469) and get the latest news sent straight to your messages. Louise Weise, Promotions Director at Lidl said: ‚ÄúOur customers rave about the quality of our Montaudon [Champagne](http://ord.co.uk/all-about/alcohol) Brut, so we were delighted that the results of the independent blind taste test confirmed what we already knew. Lidl Plus offers our customers amazing deals every single day and we wanted to celebrate with them by giving them an extra special discount this New Year‚Äôs Eve ‚Äì but they better be quick as it won‚Äôt be on shelves for long!‚Äù The [ Montaudon Champagne Brut](https://www.lidl.co.uk/p/montaudon-champagner-aop-brut/p178908) will be available for ¬£9.99 on the [Lidl Plus app](https://www.lidl.co.uk/c/lidl-plus/s10023095). If you haven't signed up for the supermarket's loyalty scheme, it is free to join and provides members with the latest discounts and offers, alongside providing points for every shop. The ¬£9.99 champagne deal is available at all Lidl [supermarkets](https://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/all-about/supermarkets ) nationwide, while stocks last. Remember that there is a maximum limit of three bottles per customer. Don't miss the latest news from around Scotland and beyond. Sign up to our daily newsletter [here](https://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/newsletter-preference-centre/?view=Solus&mailingListId=8e821752-8778-4a0d-9692-26e3f253e856&utm_source=solusarticle).

author: Derick Kinoti
title: Manchester United midfielder Casemiro tops all of Europe in key stat
text:
Manchester United star Casemiro leads Europe in a key metric, suggesting he still has something to offer the club under Ruben Amorim.
Speculation over Casemiro‚Äôs future has been rife, amidst suggestions that Sir Jim Ratcliffe and INEOS are desperate to offload him and get his hefty ¬£350,000 per week wages off the books.
During the January transfer window, it appeared like a move to Saudi Arabia was set to happen but it didn‚Äôt materialise and the Brazilian ended up staying at Old Trafford.
He has since insisted more than once that his wish is to see out his contract, which expires in the summer of 2026.
A report covered by The Peoples Person relayed that Casemiro will only move to a club that matches his salary as he is not willing to give up even a penny.
Amidst the spate of injuries the Red Devils are dealing with, Casemiro has seen his playing time dramatically improve. In the early stages of Amorim‚Äôs spell, the five-time Champions League winner was at the bottom of the pecking order but he is now a regular presence in the team.
Casemiro started both legs of United‚Äôs Europa League triumph over Real Sociedad and also came off the bench for the last 20 or so minutes of last weekend‚Äôs 3-0 victory over Leicester City. At the King Power Stadium, his superb long pass to Diogo Dalot created the opportunity for the defender to assist Bruno Fernandes for United‚Äôs third goal of the night.
Now statisticians Squawka have revealed that Casemiro is averaging more tackles per 90 minutes than any other player across Europe‚Äôs top five leagues this season.
The 33-year-old is making an impressive 4.97 tackles per 90 minutes. Bournemouth‚Äôs Tyler Adams ranks second with 4.56 tackles made per 90. Everton man Idrissa Gana Gueye rounds up the top three with 4.36 tackles per 90.
Casemiro‚Äôs teammate, Manuel Ugarte, is fourth on the list with 4.2 tackles per 90.
Most tackles per 90 in Europe‚Äôs top five leagues this season. pic.twitter.com/93HHInKbn0
‚Äî Squawka (@Squawka) March 18, 2025
Despite a noticeable decline in his speed and physicality, Casemiro continues to demonstrate his ability to make a positive impact for United.
In addition to his wealth of experience, he is still a solid disruptor and defensive stalwart in the middle of the park.
Featured image Carl Recine via Getty Images

author: 20minutos
title: Alerta de seguridad grave: cuidado si utilizas uno de estos routers antiguos
text:
El router es esencial para tener Internet en casa, aunque, de normal, los usuarios suelen tener dicho dispositivo puesto al lado del televisor para disfrutar de la mejor conexi√≥n posible desde el sal√≥n. Uno cree que colocar el router al lado de 'la caja tonta' es el mejor sitio, ya que el sal√≥n es el lugar en el que pasamos la mayor parte del tiempo, sin embargo, lo correcto es colocarlo en una zona central de la vivienda para que la se√±al llegue de manera uniforme a todas las partes de la misma.
Adem√°s, para tener una buena conexi√≥n a Internet, existen una serie de trucos o acciones que podemos hacer para mejorar nuestra se√±al del router, como la conexi√≥n USB poco conocida con la que se puede mejorar la velocidad y la estabilidad de la conexi√≥n. Sin embargo, si tu router es antiguo puede que no pueda disfrutar de todas las ventajas que ofrece uno nuevo, teniendo en cuenta que queda expuesto a ciberataques , como ha pasado recientemente con los routers de D-Link .
Dicho fabricante ha publicado una alerta de seguridad advirtiendo que varios modelos de routers antiguos presentan vulnerabilidades cr√≠ticas sin posibilidad de soluci√≥n , por lo tanto, recomienda que "los dispositivos D-Link que hayan alcanzado el fin de vida √∫til se retiren y reemplacen" porque "ya no se les puede brindar soporte de D-Link US". Adem√°s, tampoco "reciben actualizaciones de software ni parches de seguridad" .
Los dispositivos afectados son los siguientes: DSR-150, DSR-150N, DSR-250, DSR-250N, DSR-500N y DSR-1000 N . Por lo tanto, ‚ÄúD-Link recomienda encarecidamente que se retire este producto y advierte que cualquier uso posterior puede suponer un riesgo para los dispositivos conectados a √©l‚Äù, enfatiza el fabricante en su alerta.
El error que cometemos al colocar el router cerca de estos dispositivos: provocan que el WiFi sea lento

author: Benn Hanns
title: Protecting small pockets of the Hauraki Gulf will have huge impacts | The Spinoff
text: Marine ecologist Benn Hanns has spent more than 10 years sticking his head under the water in the Hauraki Gulf to monitor the effects of marine reserves, and let him tell you ‚Äì they‚Äôve got benefits. When I first started quantifying marine life in the Hauraki Gulf, I was a third younger than I am now. There were no grey hairs, and somehow I had a six pack without ever going to the gym. Times have changed. It was back then (the peak of my youth) that the Hauraki Gulf / Tƒ´kapa Moana Marine Protection Bill, which is currently before parliament, was starting to take shape among scientists, iwi and other stakeholders. Right now, only 0.3% of the Hauraki Gulf Marine Park is fully protected across six marine reserves. Even though they are relatively tiny, their impacts have been massive. Populations of important species have rebuilt, and ecosystems have been restored. In the older reserves like Goat Island (officially called Cape Rodney to Okarari Point Marine Reserve), reef predator populations such as tƒÅmure (snapper) and k≈çura (crayfish) have recovered. These predators have suppressed kina numbers and the impact of kina grazing which in turn has allowed kelp forests to flourish. Marine reserves are not surrounded by fences and their effects are not limited to their boundaries. The Goat Island marine reserve, which is only about 5km2, has been estimated to contribute up to [11% of newly settled juvenile tƒÅmure to the surrounding 400 km2](https://royalsocietypublishing.org/doi/10.1098/rspb.2017.1300). This is because marine reserves allow animals to get big and [big animals produce more eggs](https://besjournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1046/j.1365-2664.2003.00775.x) ‚Äì it takes 36 30cm-long tƒÅmure to make the same amount of eggs as one that is 70cm long. In essence, the reserve has acted as a baby snapper factory, supplementing tƒÅmure populations in surrounding areas. The protections proposed in the Hauraki Gulf / Tƒ´kapa Moana Marine Protection Bill would protect about 6% of the Gulf by extending two existing marine reserves and creating 12 new high protection areas. It would also introduce five new seafloor protection areas. The main difference between marine reserves and high protection areas (HPAs) is that while the former are ‚Äúno take‚Äù, the latter allow for customary fishing. Their placements of the proposed HPAs have been designed using key principles on size and location to create a network of effective protection around valuable ecosystems and key species. For the most part, the proposed protections have been warmly welcomed. People are well aware that the [Hauraki Gulf is facing ecological problems](https://gulfjournal.org.nz/state-of-the-gulf/) and is under pressure from fishing, contamination from surrounding land use and climate change. But, there has been some pushback from recreational fishing groups such as [Legasea](https://legasea.co.nz/2023/10/01/hauraki-gulf-marine-park-fisheries-plan/), and [interesting rhetoric](https://www.nzherald.co.nz/business/could-shane-jones-be-the-fishing-champion-the-industry-is-looking-for/NTXSBKBLVJCINAQHJK7TWCILLA/) from our new minister for oceans and fisheries Shane Jones, who is often aligned with the interests of commercial fishing. It‚Äôs a good time, then, for a reminder and deeper dive into the potential benefits the bill promises. Like the nerd my work allows me to be, I‚Äôve spent a bit of time calculating the potential benefits of the proposed protections. My research has mainly focused on crayfish and snapper, because they are key species in the gulf and have been heavily impacted by fishing. A few weeks ago I published [research in the Gulf Journal](https://gulfjournal.org.nz/2024/01/how-will-the-hauraki-gulf-tikapa-moana-marine-protection-bill-impact-fish-and-fishing-in-the-gulf/), where you can find more detail on the following. My calculations indicated the proposed HPAs have the potential to dramatically increase the biomass (literally the mass of living animals) and egg production of tƒÅmure and k≈çura in the Gulf. I estimated that the biomass of reef-associated tƒÅmure in the Hauraki Gulf could increase by 3.5 times and overall egg production could increase by 3.8 times. For k≈çura, the spawning biomass (the combined weight of all sexually mature females) could increase by 3.8 times and annual egg production by 3.3 times. These are dramatic increases considering the proposal aims to only protect 6% of the Hauraki Gulf Marine Park. The animation below shows how you‚Äôd expect the larvae to move beyond the protected areas over 10 days. Exisiting marine reserves are in purple, while the proposed HPAs are in red. This preliminary analysis uses a hydro-dynamic model which takes into consideration the movement of the water in the Gulf alongside the biology and size of tƒÅmure eggs. I also plan to make a similar model for k≈çura, so watch this space. Protecting specific areas, rather than species specific regulations on fishing is important in the Hauraki Gulf. The gulf is unique because it‚Äôs an area where recreational fishing is equally, if not more, impactful than commercial fishing. Recreational fishing has fewer limitations and is harder to manage. The beauty of protecting areas is you protect a whole ecosystem. It‚Äôs a multi-species holistic protection, which would be hard and time-consuming to achieve with regulations like size limits and catch limits. The conversation around marine protected areas is too often about fishing. These areas are about so much more. They‚Äôre not even just about being able to study things (we‚Äôve already got plenty of material). They‚Äôre about preserving. People can go snorkelling there and see a healthy ecosystem, because it still exists. They‚Äôre also about resilience ‚Äì climate change will bring new pressures and protected ecosystems will be stronger to be able to cope. When I am three times as old as I am now, there will be too many grey hairs to count. If the bill passes, fish in the gulf will multiply in the same way.

author: CNN
title: Kansas City Chiefs defeat Miami Dolphins in conditions so cold that head coach Andy Reid‚Äôs mustache freezes - KVIA
text: Kansas City Chiefs defeat Miami Dolphins in conditions so cold that head coach Andy Reid‚Äôs mustache freezes CNN By Jacob Lev, CNN (CNN) ‚Äî The Kansas City Chiefs defeated the Miami Dolphins 26-7 at Arrowhead Stadium on Saturday, in conditions so cold that Chiefs head coach Andy Reid‚Äôs mustache froze over. The temperature at kickoff was -4 degrees Fahrenheit with a wind chill of -20 degrees, making it [the fourth coldest game](https://www.cnn.com/2024/01/13/weather/coldest-nfl-games-trnd/index.html) in National Football League history, according to the Peacock broadcast. Pictures of Reid with icicles in his facial hair have since gone viral on social media. Amid the brutal conditions, the Kansas City offense hit the ground running, marching down the field on the opening drive and capping it off with an 11-yard touchdown throw from quarterback Patrick Mahomes to wide receiver Rashee Rice. Rice would go on to finish the game with eight receptions for 130 yards. The Chiefs never looked back, shutting down the Dolphins offense completely. Chiefs‚Äô kicker Harrison Butker went 4 for 4 on field goals and running back Isiah Pacheco ran it in for a three-yard rushing touchdown to put the game on ice (literally) in the fourth quarter. Mahomes finished the game with 262 yards and a touchdown. Taylor Swift was in attendance and braved the frigid temperatures wearing a #87 Kelce jacket in support of her beau Travis Kelce. Kelce finished the game with seven receptions for 71 yards. At the end of the game, the temperature was -9 degrees and felt like -28 degrees, according to the broadcast. Players could be seen huddling by pitch-side heaters and many made the most of heated benches in a bid to keep out the cold. Mahomes downplayed the weather, saying ‚Äúit is what it is‚Äù when asked about it on the Peacock broadcast after the game. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre in Kansas City, at Arrowhead,‚Äù Mahomes said. ‚ÄúWe are going to play in some games like this. So, our mentality was to come out here, play football and see what happens.‚Äù Still, Saturday‚Äôs conditions are rivaled by the coldest NFL game on record: the December 1967 ‚ÄúIce Bowl‚Äù in Wisconsin, when the Green Bay Packers beat the Dallas Cowboys amid -13 air temperature and a -48 wind chill, according to the NFL. Earlier on Saturday, the Houston Texans defeated the Cleveland Browns 45-14. It was a historic day for rookie Texans quarterback CJ Stroud, who threw for 274 yards and three touchdowns. Stroud‚Äôs three touchdown passes tied a rookie record in a playoff game. The 23-year-old former second-overall pick also became the youngest quarterback to win a playoff game in NFL history. The NFL playoffs continue on Sunday with the Green Bay Packers heading to Texas to take on the Dallas Cowboys. Matthew Stafford will also make his grand return to the city where he started his NFL career when the Los Angeles Rams take on the Detroit Lions. On Monday, the Pittsburgh Steelers head to a snowy Orchard Park, New York, to take on the Buffalo Bills and the Tampa Bay Buccaneers host the Philadelphia Eagles.
